### Section 4. Special COVID-19 Benefit

We will pay You the Benefit Limit:

a) If You are Diagnosed with COVID-19 during the Period of Insurance and is considered medically necessary by a Registered Medical Practitioner that You will be confined in an Intensive Care Unit (ICU) in a Hospital for more than five (5) days.

b) in the event of Your death as a direct result of contracting COVID-19.

The maximum amount We will pay for any one Period of Insurance is up to the Benefit Limit.

#### Exclusions Applicable to Section 4

No benefit will be payable under Section 4:
questions: How does the policy define the eligibility criteria for the Special COVID-19 Benefit in terms of diagnosis timing, medical necessity, ICU confinement duration, and death due to COVID-19?
What documentation and medical evidence are required to prove that ICU confinement for COVID-19 was medically necessary and lasted more than five days to qualify for the Special COVID-19 Benefit?
In cases where a policyholder is diagnosed with COVID-19 but confined in ICU for fewer than five days, how does the policy address benefit eligibility and potential exclusions under Section 4?
How does the Special COVID-19 Benefit interact with the overall Benefit Limit for the entire Period of Insurance, especially if multiple COVID-19 related claims arise?
What are the implications of the Special COVID-19 Benefit maximum payout being capped at the Benefit Limit for any one Period of Insurance on claims involving prolonged ICU stays or death?
If a policyholder dies from COVID-19 contracted before the Period of Insurance, is the death covered under Section 4, considering the diagnosis timing requirement?
How do general policy exclusions interact with the Section 4 exclusions for the Special COVID-19 Benefit, and which exclusions take precedence in claim adjudication?
In the event of a policyholder being diagnosed with COVID-19 and hospitalized outside of an ICU setting, how does the policy treat eligibility for the Special COVID-19 Benefit?
What is the definition of 'Diagnosed with COVID-19' in the context of this policy, and how does it affect the timing and validity of claims under Section 4?
How does the policy handle claims if the ICU confinement is medically necessary but the diagnosis of COVID-19 occurs after the Period of Insurance has ended?
Are there any specific exclusions or limitations related to pre-existing conditions or vaccination status that affect eligibility for the Special COVID-19 Benefit under Section 4?
How does the policy address claims for COVID-19 related ICU confinement that occurs due to variants or strains not explicitly mentioned in the policy wording?
What are the requirements for the Registered Medical Practitioner’s certification regarding ICU confinement and medical necessity for COVID-19 under Section 4?

If a policyholder is confined in ICU for COVID-19 but is discharged and readmitted multiple times, how does the policy calculate the five-day ICU confinement requirement for the Special COVID-19 Benefit?
How does the policy treat claims for COVID-19 death if the cause of death is complicated by other illnesses or conditions, in relation to the direct result clause in Section 4?
What are the consequences if the policyholder fails to notify the insurer within a specified timeframe after COVID-19 diagnosis or ICU confinement for Section 4 claims?
How does the policy define the Period of Insurance in relation to COVID-19 diagnosis and ICU confinement for the purpose of claiming the Special COVID-19 Benefit?
Are there any exclusions in Section 4 that specifically address quarantine, isolation without ICU admission, or mild COVID-19 cases?

How does the policy address the scenario where a policyholder is diagnosed with COVID-19 and confined in ICU for exactly five days—does this meet the eligibility criteria for the Special COVID-19 Benefit?
In the event of a claim under Section 4, how do the policy’s general exclusions, such as those related to pandemics or government travel advisories, affect the payout of the Special COVID-19 Benefit?
